Bio.title: Hi, I'm Felix!
Bio.content: I'm a mechatronics and computer science student with a passion for blending my mechanical engineering, programming, and electrical skills. I love opportunities to combine my varied interests, including game design and automotive systems. My extensive work in the assistive technology field has given me a unique perspective on accessibility and the power of engineering to change lives.

Education.description: 87% average, 3.80 GPA, Dean’s Honors List. Mechatronics specialization. Computer Science minor. Co-op program. 2022 Trek Excellence Scholarship. 2023 NSERC Undergraduate Student Research Award.

skills: Solidworks, Fusion 360, GD&T. Altium, RapidHarness, Arduino. Lathe, mill, CNC.
Unity, Unreal, Blender, OpenCV. Jira, Confluence, Git & GitHub.
Java, C, C++, C#, Python, BASH, MATLAB, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript.

jobs.title: Game Development Intern
jobs.description: Unannounced exploration & educational game for Aamjiwnaang First Nation. Unreal Engine 5. Owner of player character, NPC, dialogue, and quest systems. Manage junior data intern for game-logging support. Work directly with First Nation’s team members to develop story, dialogue, and quests.

jobs.title: Electrical Member & Recruitment Manager
jobs.description: Prototype, design, and implement custom circuit boards, sensors, and wiring harnesses on the UBC racecar. Write custom firmware for on-board systems. Lead recruitment and education for new members.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Research Intern
jobs.description: Python, supercomputing. Developed machine learning and processing framework for spectral analysis of large astronomy dataset. Introduced prediction intervals for enhanced accuracy.

jobs.title: Computational Research Intern
jobs.description: Python. Create and validate deep convolutional neural networks for modeling fluid turbulence.

jobs.title: Manufacturing Engineering Intern
jobs.description: Created manufacturing procedures, designed improved fixtures. Analyzed process data in Python. Programmed a new system to automate dispositioning of defective units. Project saves 7 eng. hours weekly and reduces defect idle time by 73%. Introduced system to 5 product lines.

jobs.title: Mechanical Engineering Design Intern
jobs.description: Created procedure to manufacture custom 3D-printed cuffs for spine-injured patients. Developed capture technology (OpenCV) and integrated Fusion 360 design pipeline with scanned mesh models.

jobs.title: Assistive Design Intern
jobs.description: Designed medical assistive devices for 3-D printing. Contributed to the assistive gaming program.
